meanings.definition: A game in which players compete to be the first to touch a designated object.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the children played a fun game of hosey to see who could reach the tree first.
meanings.sent2: Let's play a quick round of hosey to decide who gets to be the leader.
meanings.sent3: The intense game of hosey ended with everyone laughing and out of breath.
meanings.sent4: In the race to the finish line, it felt like a high-stakes game of hosey.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the air was palpable as the players prepared for a round of hosey.

meanings.definition: To claim or reserve something for oneself.
meanings.sent1: She quickly hoseyed the last piece of cake before anyone else could grab it.
meanings.sent2: I'll hosey this seat for you so you can sit next to me.
meanings.sent3: He tried to hosey the best spot in line, but others noticed and protested.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to hosey the sunny spot by the window every morning.
meanings.sent5: The student managed to hosey the last available textbook before they ran out.

meanings.definition: A type of flexible tube used for conveying liquids or gases.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic grabbed a hosey to siphon the excess oil from the engine.
meanings.sent2: The garden hosey was left out in the sun and became warm to the touch.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a never-ending string of scarves from the hosey during the show.
meanings.sent4: The hosey snaked its way through the garden, watering each plant in turn.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter quickly connected the hosey to the hydrant to put out the fire.
